subtitle: This is a spiced carrot cake with a creamy lemon frosting. For a simpler topping, dust the cake with icing sugar, or coat the top with whipped cream and decorate with walnut halves.

method.text: Grease a 20 cm round cake dish (check recommendations in your microwave operating instructions) and line the base with a circle of baking parchment, or lightly greased greaseproof paper.
Melt the butter in the microwave for 2-3 min on 50% (MEDIUM) power. Beat in the sugar and eggs.
Sift the flour, baking powder and spices and fold into the egg and sugar mixture. Finally fold in the walnuts, sultanas, grated carrots and a little milk, to make a soft dropping consistency.
Turn the mixture into the prepared dish and cook on the low or recommended rack on combination 180°C, 30% (LOW) power for 25-30 min.
Test the cake with a skewer inserted into the centre - if cooked, the skewer will come out clean. Leave in the dish for a few minutes before removing to a wire cooling rack.
To make the cream cheese frosting, cream the cheese with the icing sugar and lemon juice until smooth. When the cake is cold, coat with the frosting.
